column5: According to what I read this morning there will be  4" Tetrad" eclipses tonight. There have been a total of 8 of this type of eclipse in the last 2000 years. My 3 year old great niece won't see another one unless she lives to 100. I hope it's not overcast. The article didn't say what time or much more than what I said here.  Anyone have anymore info than that?

The lunar eclipse is already over if I am not mistaken happened at 6:00AM this morning unless you are talking about something else haven't heard of 4" Tetrad eclipses before.  Kawartha Kev  http://www.spaceweather.com/

This was the third partial eclipse in a series of  4 eclipses this year, the last will be in September.  The series of 4 makes it the 'Tetrad".  This particular one was really not visible here as the moon was below the horizon.  http://www.npr.org/blogs/thetwo-way/2015/04/03/397322864/get-ready-for-the-third-installment-in-the-lunar-eclipse-tetrad
